title: Dog walker blinded in one eye afer being whipped in the face with belt
text:
Caption: Man blinded in one eye after being whipped in the face with a belt

Langley Memorial Park

A man in his 40s completely lost sight in one eye after a thug whipped him in the face with a belt.

Police say the victim was walking a dog through Memorial Park in Langley, Slough, Berkshire, when he was approached by a group of four men.

One of them asked the target for a cigarette before removing his belt and whipping him in the face.

He completely lost his vision in one eye and it is not known if it will ever be recovered.

Thames Valley police are seeking a female dog walker who they believe could have witnessed the incident.

The victim attended two hospitals in the area for treatment and has now been discharged.

Authorities say the man who whipped him is black, in his early to mid-20s and around 5ft tall.

He was of slim build, had an afro style haircut and was wearing a brown knee length coat and a dark fur-lined hood.

Another man from the group, who was wearing a red coat, is described as being around 6ft 4 inches tall, white, with spiked blonde hair.

Slough Force CID investigator Reece Harris said: ‘It was an unprovoked assault and I am appealing for anyone who was in the area at this time that may have seen or heard something to come forward.

‘I am particularly appealing to trace the woman whose dog the victim was walking at the time.

‘She lives locally and I would like to speak to her to see if she has any information that could help with my investigation.’

description: Thames Valley Police are investigating an attack with belt in Langley Memorial Park, Berkshire, which left a man partially blinded.
